name: Sol Palmeras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Sol Palmeras and had a great time. It was my boyfriend, and myself along with another couple. We went at the beinging of May so the weather was awesome. Blue skys all day everyday. Just all around great weather.
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.text: The only thing I dissliked about the resport was the buffet. Breakfast was okay but lunch and dinner didnt settle well with me. I was sick for the first three days we got their, with a very unsettled stomach. I don't know if it was the food because I was the only one who got this sick. I took all my shots before we went away, luckly it didnt last the whole time. Because we didnt like the buffet we made friends with one of the waiters at the steakhouse. We tipped him well so every night we went there for dinner and he got us a table. They had a few options for off the menu dinners as well for an additional price of $20.00... seriously, the best lobster and steak I have ever had! I would have paid this every night if I brought enough money. We loved it so much we didnt want to try any other a la carts..
reviews.title: Liked it!

reviews.text: Anyways, the beachs were like nothing I had ever seen. They were prestine. Turquoise water, private beach with cliff overhang on each side so only poeple from our resort was there. You dont have other travellers snooping around.
reviews.title: Great vacation at Sol Palmeras but...

reviews.text: We had a bungalow which was awsome! Again, we tipped the maides and left them candy, clothes etc, so she would leave us extra water and booze. She did a great job cleaning as well. The people were great. Not pushy and very laid back. We brought lots of gifts which they really appreciated.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful vacation this year in Cuba.

reviews.text: We even went into town just the four of us. We rented mopeds and drove all down the cove and back to town where we went to the market. Felt super safe and had tons of fun. In addition to this, there was even closer shopping malls right outside of the resort.. A free shuttle will take you and pick you up. The shuttle will even bring you to the a la carts.
reviews.title: family vacation in cuba

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sol Palmeras hotel this past November 2006, and it was a awesome experience. I was travelling with my family and it was our first time in Cuba. Everything exceeded our expectations. Weather was great, since it was at the end of hurricane season-everyday had clear skies and warm weather.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Rooms were clean, good selection of food, friendly staff and amazing beach
likes.disliked: — Not much entertainment besides the nightly shows

reviews.text: When checking in at the hotel, I found the front desk to be extremely helpful. All staff very friendly from the start and took the time to say 'hola' whenever you walk by.
reviews.title: what a country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Starting with the rooms, we were given a junior suite with a king bed and pull out sofa. Good size and more than enough room for 3 people. Rooms were spotless and airconditioned. Views were great no matter the location because you will always see water from the hotel, and the foliage around is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Christmas and New year

reviews.text: The restaurants were good, despite what many people say about food in Cuba. I really enjoyed the buffet as there was alot of selection and was always fresh-especially the bread!
reviews.title: Wedding
Pleasurable stay
reviews.text: It was always good to come early to the buffet restaurant, 'La Panchita' when the food would be hot, fresh and hasn't been sifted through. Although certain foods were bland like the pasta, the Cuban food was always the best choice at the buffet. For the a la carte restaurants, its always good to book in advance. That we didn't know cause it was our first time at an all-inclusive. Nevertheless, we managed to try the French, 'La Fondue' and Chinese 'Oshin' restaurants. My favourite was the Chinese it was quite tasty, and seemed close to the real thing.

Just came back today 12/01/2012 well fab holiday the hotel is a little dated service from a lot of staff seemed to be a chore unless you spoke Spanish hotel favours south Americans Brits get blue bands every other nationality get gold never got a answer to that one ?food is the let down warm never hot lot of choice but very repetitive and when it was gone it was gone coffee machine s 4 in buffet restaurant served water and broke down all the time the 4 a la carte restaurants try hard but Chinese it certainly it wasn't pasta passing for noodles! Def not to the quality of other hotels of this rating we have stayed at We stayed in the hotel which was close to all facilities really felt the Brits
reviews.title: Butlins in the sun

reviews.text: We returned to the Sol Palmeras for a second time, after having spent a wonderful week there during the March Break in 2008. It was a great holiday and the accommodations, food and activities were all fine. Some improvements have been made over the past 4 years, starting at the airport (which has been upgraded quite a bit) and continuing to the hotel, where there have been significant advances to the check-in system and currency exchange (more computers, much quicker and less bureaucratic), some renovations in the main lobby area and the restaurant closest to the beach and the welcome addition of an all-day ice-cream stand near the pool.
reviews.title: Second visit -- and still very good.

reviews.text: We were very happy to be upgraded to bungalows upon arrival AND to get access to our rooms at noon instead of waiting until 4 p.m. The bungalows are spacious and comfortable, although not super modern. We didn't use the kitchenette at all but the fridge and coffee maker could have been handy. The television offered a variety of channels, including CNN, but we spent very little time indoors.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few things disappointed us compared to last time. First, the quality of the coffee: it used to be great in the buffet restaurant at breakfast and exceptional if you went to the lobby bar for an espresso or a cappuchino during the day. Now it now comes out of a machine in the restaurant (seriously yech) and the espresso machine produces something that is good but not great. Second disappointment was the music: whereas the lobby bar offered a live Cuban band most evenings the last time we were there, a karaoke machine is featured now, with a mediocre selection of "golden oldies" on offer by singers who have more enthusiasm than talent. Only two of the restaurants offered any live music -- a fabulous Cuban group in one, and a so-so woodwind ensemble in the other. Elsewhere it was recorded music, favouring electronic pop stuff played too loudly. Maybe the fact that we were there during the busy March Break week last time explains the difference but the music was something we had looked forward to and really missed. The sound system on the beach was in bad shape but it hammered away at full volume most of the day. Would have been happy to just listen to the waves and the birds -- music is quite unneccessary except for the unavoidable beach games and aerobics classes.
reviews.title: Some good and bad. Overall OK

reviews.text: The beach and pool areas are beautiful, clean and well-mantained and there were lots of palapas and chairs available most of the time. We only watched a bit of the nightly entertainment -- more of the same music along with dancers who were capable but sadled with fairly run of the mill choreography.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sol Palmeras for a week, the hotel is in a great location and the beach is fantastic, for September the weather was magnificent,
reviews.title: Decent enough but in need of a make over.

reviews.text: The rooms are acceptable but I would not rate the hotel as a 4 star it would be more of 3 or possibly a 3.5.
reviews.title: My first time but will definiately will not be my last time - Excellebt holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best restaurant was the Chinese but still a limited menu. We enjoyed the buffet restaurant the selection was good but like any buffet some of the items could be cold. My advice would be to go to the counters were they will cook something there for you pasta, kebabs, pork chops etc.
reviews.title: Don't let the bad reviews put you off!

reviews.text: The hotel reception staff were very good, courteous and helpful. The bar staff are too busy looking for tips rather than doing there job.
reviews.title: cuba holiday

reviews.text: Overall this was a good trip and I would go back but still feel that a little paint here and there and some upgrades would help this hotel in the long term
reviews.title: Love, love Sol Palmeras...will be back for our 3rd vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reports did wonder what we were going to but all doubts went away when we arrived. This place was so friendly and so helpful. There were a couple of rude bar staff at the beach bar but they certainly didn’t spoil the holiday, after a few pina coladas (with rum of course) who cares - we’re on holiday! It was my birthday while we were away and my husband organised flowers and a meal at the steakhouse. This was great, the band sang happy birthday, they had also made me a cake with my name on and 2 bottles of champagne and that wasn’t including the fruit and champagne put in our room. Of course the flowers and cake were paid for but the other bits were a nice touch. I even had balloons at breakfast.
reviews.title: Great holiday

likes.liked: — 24 hour all inclusive and plenty of activities

reviews.title: We loved our holiday at the Sol Palmeras
reviews.text: We did archery, shooting, salsa dancing, learning bongos, table tennis, kayaking, snorkelling and was taken out on a catamaran at the hotel. Unfortunately due to bad weather and choppy conditions the water sports were not available everyday.

reviews.title: Best Vacation
reviews.text: The evening entertainment was a bit the same as other hotels and not the worst I’ve seen but we didn’t watch much of it as we met up with a great crowd of people and by the time we’d met in the bar after dinner and had a chat the entertainment had finished anyway. The magician was very good though and also the fantasia show that we did go to see. The fun pub was OK if you fancied a dance and the bar staff in there were very good and even went off to find salt and lemon when we decided to do tequila shots. They didn’t expect a tip but as we got a excellent service from them we left a tip at the end of the holiday and they were very pleased with it.

Food was great and you couldn’t go hungry. No problems booking the restaurants as you could book up to 3 days in advance, and the buffet was great too. My favourite was the Italian. It was nice to dress for dinner and going to these restaurants you have to dress smartly.
reviews.title: The best way to get married

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did the jeep safari which was great, snorkelling in coral reefs, then a cave tour, onto a farm for lunch and a ride on a horse, then onto another cave for swimming in. Some people were told they couldn’t go on the safari as they weren’t insured to drive but you are 4 to a jeep so there will be someone or even a guide to drive. The speed boats were a good morning out but make sure you take sunglasses and a towel. My husband went deep sea fishing and 3 of the 4 caught fish, they said that was good fun, there is plenty to do there that I didn’t even get to read all the books I took. The trips may be a bit expensive but they are good value for money as you do get a lot more included than trips I’ve been on in Europe.
reviews.title: Fantastic honeymoon/renewal of vows ceremony!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cuba is not equal in quality to other countries when it comes to tourism as it has limited resources so be aware if you have never been and compare Cuban hotels to each other rather than internationally.
reviews.title: Lovely beach, tacky entertainment, choose a bungalow for peace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Lovely safe and clean beach, we could always get loungers and shade and get away from the crowds. Gorgeous turquoise sea water. Pools big with lots of loungers but hardly anyone in them when we were there. Poolside crowded with loungers with no space between them (we preferred the beach)
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Food is generally good considering it is Cuba. Almost grotesque in quantity available, especially when you see what the Cubans eat and can get in their shops. The buffet restaurant had so many dishes you could eat different food every night. Puddings didn't vary much however (ice cream, cake and caramelised banana - not a problem for us). Very friendly waiters and waitresses who looked after everyone very well.
reviews.title: Good place if you are in a bungalow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The Mexican restaurant food completely inedible and possibly the worst food I have ever had; avoid bothering to book this. Really disgusting.
reviews.title: We have stayed several times!

reviews.text: -Bungalows very quiet at night, spacious, outdoor terrace and lovely gardens. 1980s in appearance and decor, felt a bit Butlins holiday camp to us but very clean and excellent shower.
reviews.title: The sun, beach, the accomodations and the people were amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do i start, i have never been on a better holiday. From the minute we met our Rep at the airport, (well if you can call it an airport, i've seen bigger McDonald drive thru's.) The Rep was called Luis, on the coach to the resort he gave us our room keys and said he had already checked us all in, this meant that we would not have to mess about and was able to get our case and go straight to our room. We was met at the hotel by a local band playing Cuban Salsa music which was quality. The hotel lobby was awsome, loads of comfortable chairs and sofa to sit around the bar and enjoy cocktails or beer. Always live music playing, either round the pool, on the beach, in the resturants or in the lobby. We bathed for 2 days before organizing any trips. We did the swimming with Dolphins which was out of this world. Yeah the water didnt look the cleanest but it was a lagoon. The Dolphins were very well kept and showed lots of signs of happiness. We went on the Catermaran trip which is a must, i could tell you everything about it but then it would ruin your experience (let's just say we went to Paradise). We never went to Havanna as we only went for 1 week (what a mistake that was). The Havanna trip sounded awsome but i would of wanted a day to recover from the travelling (our mistake). The 7 resturants were awsome, the stakehouse i thought was the best. The hotel staff were out of this world, they could not do enough for you. Our maid Mary made something different with our towels every morning, she was so sweet. We tipped her daily and at the end of our holiday i gave her mine and my partners toiletries, it was like giving someone a winning lottery ticket. We are going back but for 2 weeks this time. Please try this hotel it was amazing and so very friendly. If you do decide to go back say hello to Ernesto the barman in the Lobby for me (what a guy).
reviews.title: "WOW" we will definately be going back !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had lovely time with my girlfriend here,all i can say is dont listen to all the bad reviews everyone else rights about this place,they need to shape up and get a life really,your on hoilday so make it the best you can no matter how much you hate it you paid all that money out so shape up people,thought the hotel was really nice rooms great ,staff great,also i didnt think i would like cuban food but some of it is better than home there also so much to choose from,if you love the beach your love this place its out of this world,always clean,there a bar there that serves food and BEER all day long,loved the excursions too especially the catamaran great day out,it is a really nice place people, so dont listen to all them donuts who right reveiws moaning about anything and everything they need too take a look in the mirror, have fun.......
reviews.title: miss beach and sunshine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do i start .This holiday was fantastic the staff couldnt do enough for us, the room was clean the food was good and also the entertainment ,the team worked very hard. The beach was clean with crystal clear waters we could get something to eat or drink day or night. We were met at the Hotel by a cuban band playing guitars and singing this gave us our first taste with cuba. We booked a day trip to Havana it was hot but we really enjoyed it, you can book several trips from the Hotel but you neednt leave if you dont want to, everything is laid on. We would definately go back to this Hotel and are planning our next holiday there
reviews.title: Were going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very hot, rained twice at night. Rooms comfortable with huge beds.....ask for sunny balcony though, dont go on the ground floor. Food lovely, cuban least favourite chinese the best. Even buffet was really good. Beaches amazing white sand clear waters...........real paradise. Always able to get beds on the beach and by the pool. Entertainment team wrok really hard always something going on............never get bored. Hotel is definatley 4 star..................would recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Beach and Hotel Staff Excellent, Entertainment Night and Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I (early 20's) stayed here from the 4th - 18th September, and we had fantastic time, our travel agent was Thomson/ First Choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday, Great Value For Money....Enjoy!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here in May, a group of 4. We had two rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation, with some minor setbacks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!
outstanding
reviews.text: - Very clean and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Small Balcony
reviews.title: best holiday ever.

likes.disliked: — no tea or coffee facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - In-Room Safe
reviews.title: Not bad - but been to better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Sol Palmeras and are glad we didnt take much notice of some of the pettier reviews of this hotel. Its hard to believe some of the compaints people had of the place.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel

likes.liked: — Very good food and very good location

reviews.text: For the price bracket its very good value for money, having everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The 'a la carte' restaurants were very good, we especially enjoyed the italian and the chinese and the service was done with a smile. Definately have the lobster in the steakhouse even if it does cost 20 peso's each since it came with shrimp and a delightful steak, its well worth the money. The buffet had a wide enough range to suit all tastes and was of a good quality. We had little trouble gettiing a drink from the bar and although the bar staff could have seemed happier, this would hardly contribute to putting a downer on our stay.
reviews.title: Loved the Sol Palmeras

reviews.text: The pool retiling was little more than a slight setback, since you had the fantastic beach and sea to swim in, besides that, we still had the other section to use if you wanted to. As for the noise levels, it wont affect you much if you arent fussy enough to let it. The hotel grounds were very impressive and provided a nice tropical setting for our stay. The Havana overnight trip was very good and the tour guide was especially a character. It was definately good value for money, and if you like your site-seeing then you will be in your element. The Dolphin swim was also very enjoyable if you appreciate it for what it is, and are not deluded into thinking your going to get something too special. The sea fari Cayo-Blanco is a very enjoyable trip if the weather holds out and the snokelling was fun.
reviews.title: Wouldn't recommand this resort to my worst enemy

reviews.text: Varadero itself was very nice and the whole peninsula was beautiful.The weather could have been better but that hardly the fault of Sol Pameras, the room was clean and the maid kept it tidy, and she was friendly enough and sometimes made us swans out of the towels and left us a friendly good-bye note.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Average!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, the hotel is good value for money if your not expecting to be treated like a king and are not excessively fussy by nature. I would recommend the hotel to anyone and we had a most enjoyable stay, we probably wouldnt go back to the hotel since we dont like visiting the same place twice but we wouldnt hestitate to recommend it to other young or middle aged couples looking for a relaxing break.
reviews.title: Don't eat the broccoli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bungalows were great. Excellent pool and night entertainment. Good food and drinks.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend it and will go back.
reviews.title: Memorable Cuban Holiday

reviews.text: I went to the Sol Palmeras resort with a friend who had been there two times before. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the bungalows which we thoroughly enjoyed. We did request however, to be relocated to the 100 group of bungalows which is closer to the resort and to the main beach. Absolutely loved bungalow 111.
reviews.title: Sol Palmeras..........My Home Away From Home

reviews.text: The service from the staff was remarkable. We tipped all service personnel and got fantastic service as a result. There was always a table waiting for us, beverages bought to our table, and extra bananas from the banana lady at the desert counter. It is amazing how one can be treated like a queen by tipping one peso!!! Loved it.
reviews.title: Shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good but I did get sick. My friend ate most of the same things I ate and she never got sick at all - everyone is different!! The Chinese a la carte was fantastic (we went there 3 times). We also liked the Italian a la carte but the soup at the seafood a la carte was horrible. They did put a lot of salt on the fish and chicken but the fish was always very tasty and the deep fried chicken on the lunch buffet was very good. And, the blue cheese was a big hit - very tastey. Lots of food to choose from.
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.text: I have travelled to Cuba many times, and use tripadvisor religiously to pick out hotels where I will be staying. I have to say that the 1st day we arrived, we were very disappointed with the hotel, it is old and in need of some renovations. I can understand why many rate this hotel highly, and it has to do with the staff, from the entertainment crew to the staff in all restaurants, we found everyone to be friendly and attentive. The beach is beautiful and the fun pub at night is a good option for those looking for something to do after dinner within the hotel. With that being said, please be aware that this hotel is by no means a 4 star even within Cuba. It is difficult to hang out in the lobby area at night, because the air does not appear to be circulated, there are no fans or open air spaces within the lobby so it gets extremely stuffy especially with cigarette smoke. The food in buffet restaurant is ok, you will never go hungry but again selection is not as varied as in other hotels where we have stayed. If you are looking for a great cappucino, see Nivaldo, the best bartender within this resort at the bar outside the stage area. This is a solid 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Solid 3 star
Excellent Hotel",Fantastic Country", "Wonderful People"..... what more can i say? Read on!!
reviews.text: First time to Cuba and having read some of the negative reviews we were a bit dubious to say the least!!
what a fantastic surprise!!! we were welcomed into Cuba as if we were one of their own
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: The Hotel
reviews.title: a complete waste of money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: always buzzing day noon or night first class service from the staff wether in any of the bars or the resteraunts would particularly like to thank Julio Ceaser and his wife i think her name is Candida
reviews.title: Amazing Holidays in a Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this resort for two weeks in August of this year and the only word i can use to decribe this place is NIGHTMARE. I have written a 14 page complaint letter to First Choice highlighting everything that went wrong but suffice to say that we have never experienced such poor service food and drink. I am a vegetarian and did not eat anything substantial for 2 weeks. This hotel was sold to us as a 4 star hotel however I would prefer to stay in my garden shed for 2 weeks!!
reviews.title: Nightmare!!

reviews.text: My advice avoid Cuba and this resort - it is disgusting!!
reviews.title: Oh Sol Palmeras

reviews.text: I am very sorry if you have already booked your trip to Cuba and I do not mean to cause you any offence however my advice would be to stick to Europe as you know what you are getting.
reviews.title: Clean facilities, friendly staff, and awesome beach... what more can you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would be very itnerested in hearing from other guests who had a bad experience with this hotel as this would be helpful if I decide to take legal action.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Short but honest review.
reviews.title: Great beach, good food, could improve on service/appearance

description: Located in Varadero Beach, this 4 star, all inclusive Hotel offers all of the great dining, activities and entertainment facilities that have made Sol Melia a recognized leader in quality hotels! Ideal for families and honeymooners. 376 comfortable double rooms, 28 Junior Suites, 4 Suites and 200 Bungalows with direct access to the beach. 6 Restaurantes, 7 Bars, Mini Club and Minidisco, Mini-Golf. Motorized water sports. Sol Palmeras combine great fun with a beautiful beach.
